New Records: Serhou Guirassy scored the first hat-trick in 2025 Africa Cup of Nations qualifiers
Key Match Events: Azzedine Ounahi netted twice, Abde Ezzalzouli, Achraf Hakimi, and Soufiane Rahimi scored one each for Morocco
Seydouba Cisse scored for Guinea after an assist from Mady Camara
Pre-Game Insights: Morocco (nine points) opted for competitive match practice instead of playing friendlies
Post-Match Reflections: Michel Dussuyer, the 65-year-old French coach of Guinea, began a fourth spell in charge of the team
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pace and power of Guirassy was too much for Ethiopia to handle
Guinea netted four times within 48 minutes after scoring just once in their previous two matches
Others: Morocco equalled the biggest winning margin in 2025 qualifying after South Africa set the benchmark with a five-goal drubbing of Congo
DR Congo top the table with nine points and share perfect records halfway through qualifying with Algeria, Angola, Egypt, Ivory Coast, and Morocco
